column1:
User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The DestroyBlockapplication first allows a game admin to design a DestroyBlockgame and then players to play the game and compete for an entry in the game's hall of fame.

DESIGN GAME:A user has a unique username. A user is always a player and optionally an admin. A user has the same password as a player and as an admin and chooses the admin mode or play mode when logging into the application. Only an admin may create a game.

Each game has a unique name and its own hall of fame. The admin designs a game by defining a set of blocks. Each block has a color and is worth a certain number of points between 1 and 1000 as specified by the admin.

A game has several levels as defined by the admin. Levels are numbered starting with Level 1 and the maximum number of levels is 99. For each level, the admin specifies the starting arrangement of blocks. Each block is placed in one cell of a grid system. The block at the top left corner is in grid position 1/1, the one to the right of it is in grid position 2/1, the one below it is in grid position 1/2, and so on. The admin may also define a level as random, i.e., the blocks at the top are randomly selected for the level from the set of blocks defined by the admin.

The number of blocks shown at the beginning of each level is the same and is also defined by the admin. With each level, the speed of the ball increases starting at its minimum speed and the length of the paddle is reduced gradually from its maximum length to its minimum length. The minimum speed, speed increase factor, maximum length, and minimum length are all specified by the admin for the game.

PLAY GAME: A player can play a game when it is published by the game admin. At the beginning of a game or level, the DestroyBlockapplication places the blocks at the top of the play area as specified by the admin in the design phase. The ball is placed in the center of the play area and drops in a straight line towards the bottom. The paddle of the player is positioned in the middle at the bottom of the play area. The player moves the paddle to the right or left at the bottom of the play area while trying to bounce the ball towards the blocks. The ball moves at a certain speed in a certain direction. The ball bounces back from the wall at the top as well as the two side walls on the right and left. If the ball hits a block, the ball bounces back, the block disappears, and the player scores the points of the hit block.

When the ball hits the last block, the player advances to the next level. If the ball reaches the bottom wall, the ball is out-of-bounds and the player loses one life. The player starts a game with three lives. When the player has lost all three lives or the player has finished the last level, the game ends and the total score is displayed in the game?? hall of fame.

At the end of a level or when the player pauses the game, the game is saved. A paused game can be resumed by the player. The next level of a game does not start automatically but only upon player confirmation.

A user may be a player for one game and an admin for another game but cannot be both for the same game. There is only one admin per game. Players compete against each other for the high score in the game?? hall of fame. A player may play different games and the same game multiple times. However, only one game may be played at any point in time, i.e., games are not played in parallel.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **GameMode**  
   - PLAY
   - ADMIN

### Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: GameMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List\<Player>
     - levels: List\<Level>
     - blocks: List\<Block>
     - maxLevels: int
     - blockCount: int
     - ballSpeed: int
     - paddleLength: int

3. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List\<Block>

4. **Block**
   - Attributes:
     - color: String
     - points: int

5. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - score: int
     - lives: int

### Associations:
- **User** has a **GameMode**
- **Game** has a list of **Levels**, **Blocks**, and **Players**
- **Level** has a list of **Blocks**
- **Player** has a **username**, **score**, and **lives**

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:### Enumerations:
1. GameMode(PLAY, ADMIN): Represents the mode in which a user can interact with the game, either as a player or an admin.

### Classes:
1. User(username: String, password: String, mode: GameMode): Represents a user of the DestroyBlock application with a unique username, password, and role as a player or admin.
   
2. Game(name: String, hallOfFame: List<Player>, levels: List<Level>, blocks: List<Block>, maxLevels: int, blockCount: int, ballSpeed: int, paddleLength: int): Represents a game in DestroyBlock with its attributes such as name, hall of fame, levels, blocks, and game settings.

3. Level(levelNumber: int, blockArrangement: List<Block>): Represents a level in the game with a level number and the arrangement of blocks for that level.

4. Block(color: String, points: int): Represents a block in the game with a color and points value.

5. Player(username: String, score: int, lives: int): Represents a player in the game with a username, score, and remaining lives.

AI:## Enumerations:
1. **GameMode**: Represents the mode in which a user logs into the application, either as an admin or a player.
   
## Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: string
     - password: string
     - isAdmin: boolean
     - gameMode: GameMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: string
     - hallOfFame: HallOfFame
     - blocks: List<Block>
     - levels: List<Level>
     - minSpeed: int
     - speedIncreaseFactor: int
     - maxPaddleLength: int
     - minPaddleLength: int

3. **Block**
   - Attributes:
     - color: string
     - points: int

4. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List<Block>
     - isRandom: boolean
     - numBlocks: int

5. **HallOfFame**
   - Attributes:
     - highScores: List<HighScore>

6. **HighScore**
   - Attributes:
     - player: User
     - score: int

7. **PlayArea**
   - Attributes:
     - blocks: List<Block>
     - ball: Ball
     - paddle: Paddle

8. **Ball**
   - Attributes:
     - speed: int
     - direction: string

9. **Paddle**
   - Attributes:
     - length: int
     - position: int

## Associations:
- **User** can be associated with multiple **Games**.
- **Game** has a one-to-one association with **HallOfFame**.
- **Game** has a one-to-many association with **Block** and **Level**.
- **Level** has a one-to-many association with **Block**.
- **HallOfFame** has a one-to-many association with **HighScore**.
- **HighScore** has a many-to-one association with **User**.
- **PlayArea** has a composition relationship with **Block**, **Ball**, and **Paddle**.

...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:Enumerations:
1. GameMode (ADMIN, PLAYER): Represents the mode in which a user logs into the application, either as an admin or a player.

Classes:
1. User(username: string, password: string, isAdmin: boolean, gameMode: GameMode): Represents a user in the DestroyBlock application with unique username, password, and roles as admin or player.
   
2. Game(name: string, hallOfFame: HallOfFame, blocks: List<Block>, levels: List<Level>, minSpeed: int, speedIncreaseFactor: int, maxPaddleLength: int, minPaddleLength: int): Represents a game in DestroyBlock with its attributes like name, hall of fame, blocks, levels, and game settings.

3. Block(color: string, points: int): Represents a block in the game with color and points value.

4. Level(levelNumber: int, blockArrangement: List<Block>, isRandom: boolean, numBlocks: int): Represents a level in the game with level number, block arrangement, randomness, and number of blocks.

5. HallOfFame(highScores: List<HighScore>): Represents the hall of fame in the game with a list of high scores.

6. HighScore(player: User, score: int): Represents a high score entry with the player and their score.

7. PlayArea(blocks: List<Block>, ball: Ball, paddle: Paddle): Represents the play area in the game with blocks, ball, and paddle.

8. Ball(speed: int, direction: string): Represents the ball in the game with speed and direction.

9. Paddle(length: int, position: int): Represents the paddle in the game with length and position.

AI:Enumerations:
1. GameMode(PLAY, ADMIN): Represents the mode in which a user can interact with the application, either as a player or an admin.

Classes:
1. User(username: String, password: String, mode: GameMode): Represents a user of the application with a unique username, password, and mode of interaction (PLAY or ADMIN).
   
2. Game(name: String, hallOfFame: List<Player>, levels: List<Level>, blocks: List<Block>, maxLevels: int, blockCount: int, ballSpeed: int, paddleLength: int, minPaddleLength: int, speedIncreaseFactor: int): Represents a game with various attributes such as name, hall of fame, levels, blocks, and game settings like maximum levels, block count, ball speed, and paddle length.

3. Level(levelNumber: int, blockArrangement: List<Block>): Represents a level within a game with a level number and a specific arrangement of blocks.

4. Block(color: String, points: int): Represents a block in the game with a color and a point value.

5. Player(username: String, score: int, lives: int, currentLevel: int, currentGame: Game): Represents a player in the game with attributes like username, score, remaining lives, current level, and the game being played.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **UserMode**  
   - PLAY_MODE
   - ADMIN_MODE

### Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: UserMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List\<Player>
     - levels: List\<Level>
     - blocks: List\<Block>
     - blockSet: Set\<Block>
     - maxLevels: int
     - blockArrangement: Map\<Level, List\<Block>>
     - numBlocksPerLevel: int
     - ballSpeed: int
     - speedIncreaseFactor: int
     - maxPaddleLength: int
     - minPaddleLength: int
     - admin: User

3. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List\<Block>
     - random: boolean

4. **Block**
   - Attributes:
     - color: String
     - points: int

   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - score: int
     - lives: int
     - currentGame: Game
     - paused: boolean

- **Game** has a one-to-many association with **Block**
- **Game** has a one-to-many association with **Player**
- **Level** has a one-to-many association with **Block**
- **Player** has a one-to-one association with **Game**

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The DestroyBlockapplication first allows a game admin to design a DestroyBlockgame and then players to play the game and compete for an entry in the game's hall of fame.

DESIGN GAME:A user has a unique username. A user is always a player and optionally an admin. A user has the same password as a player and as an admin and chooses the admin mode or play mode when logging into the application. Only an admin may create a game.

Each game has a unique name and its own hall of fame. The admin designs a game by defining a set of blocks. Each block has a color and is worth a certain number of points between 1 and 1000 as specified by the admin.

A game has several levels as defined by the admin. Levels are numbered starting with Level 1 and the maximum number of levels is 99. For each level, the admin specifies the starting arrangement of blocks. Each block is placed in one cell of a grid system. The block at the top left corner is in grid position 1/1, the one to the right of it is in grid position 2/1, the one below it is in grid position 1/2, and so on. The admin may also define a level as random, i.e., the blocks at the top are randomly selected for the level from the set of blocks defined by the admin.

The number of blocks shown at the beginning of each level is the same and is also defined by the admin. With each level, the speed of the ball increases starting at its minimum speed and the length of the paddle is reduced gradually from its maximum length to its minimum length. The minimum speed, speed increase factor, maximum length, and minimum length are all specified by the admin for the game.

PLAY GAME: A player can play a game when it is published by the game admin. At the beginning of a game or level, the DestroyBlockapplication places the blocks at the top of the play area as specified by the admin in the design phase. The ball is placed in the center of the play area and drops in a straight line towards the bottom. The paddle of the player is positioned in the middle at the bottom of the play area. The player moves the paddle to the right or left at the bottom of the play area while trying to bounce the ball towards the blocks. The ball moves at a certain speed in a certain direction. The ball bounces back from the wall at the top as well as the two side walls on the right and left. If the ball hits a block, the ball bounces back, the block disappears, and the player scores the points of the hit block.

When the ball hits the last block, the player advances to the next level. If the ball reaches the bottom wall, the ball is out-of-bounds and the player loses one life. The player starts a game with three lives. When the player has lost all three lives or the player has finished the last level, the game ends and the total score is displayed in the game?? hall of fame.

At the end of a level or when the player pauses the game, the game is saved. A paused game can be resumed by the player. The next level of a game does not start automatically but only upon player confirmation.

A user may be a player for one game and an admin for another game but cannot be both for the same game. There is only one admin per game. Players compete against each other for the high score in the game?? hall of fame. A player may play different games and the same game multiple times. However, only one game may be played at any point in time, i.e., games are not played in parallel.

1. **UserMode**:
   - Admin
   - Player

### Classes:

   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: UserMode

2. **Game**:
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List\<Player>
     - levels: List\<Level>
     - blocks: List\<Block>
     - maxLevels: int
     - blockCount: int
     - ballSpeed: int
     - paddleLength: int
     - minSpeed: int
     - speedIncreaseFactor: int
     - maxLength: int
     - minLength: int

3. **Level**:
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List\<Block>

4. **Block**:
   - Attributes:
     - color: String
     - points: int

5. **Player**:
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - score: int
     - lives: int
     - currentLevel: int
     - currentGame: Game

### Associations:
- **User** 1..1 ---- 1..* **Player**
- **User** 1..1 ---- 1..1 **Admin**
- **Admin** 1..* ---- 1..1 **Game**
- **Game** 1..* ---- 1..* **Player**
- **Game** 1..* ---- 1..* **Level**
- **Game** 1..* ---- 1..* **Block**

3. Level(levelNumber: int, blockArrangement: List<Block>): Represents a level in a game with a level number and block arrangement.

AI:### Enumerations:

   - PLAY
   - ADMIN

### Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: GameMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List<Player>
     - levels: List<Level>
     - blocks: List<Block>
     - maxLevels: int
     - blockCount: int
     - ballSpeed: int
     - paddleLength: int

3. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List<Block>

### Associations:
- **User** has a one-to-one association with **Player**
- **User** has a one-to-many association with **Game**
- **Game** has a one-to-many association with **Level**
- **Game** has a one-to-many association with **Block**
- **Level** has a one-to-many association with **Block**
- **Game** has a one-to-many association with **Player** (for hall of fame)
- **Player** has a many-to-one association with **Game** (for playing a game)
- **Player** has a one-to-many association with **Level** (for saving progress)
- **Player** has a one-to-one association with **Game** (for resuming paused game)

AI:### Enumerations:
1. GameMode(ADMIN, PLAY): Represents the mode in which a user can interact with the game, either as an admin or a player.

### Classes:
1. User(username: String, password: String, mode: GameMode): Represents a user with a unique username, password, and the mode in which they are interacting with the game.
   
2. Player(user: User, lives: Integer): Represents a player associated with a user and their remaining lives in the game.

3. Admin(user: User): Represents an admin associated with a user who has the authority to create and manage games.

4. Game(name: String, hallOfFame: List<Player>, levels: List<Level>, blocks: List<Block>, initialBlockCount: Integer, ballSpeed: Integer, paddleLength: Integer): Represents a game with its name, hall of fame, levels, blocks, and game settings.

5. Level(number: Integer, blockArrangement: List<Block>, isRandom: Boolean): Represents a level in a game with a number, block arrangement, and indication if it's randomly generated.

6. Block(color: String, points: Integer): Represents a block with a color and points value when hit by the ball.

7. Ball(speed: Integer, direction: String): Represents the ball in the game with its speed and direction of movement.

8. Paddle(position: Integer): Represents the paddle controlled by the player to bounce the ball back towards the blocks.
